reviewText: There are a number of "copies" of this 1987 concert film floating around that are not authorized releases and are essentially very mediocre bootlegs. This DVD is an authorized Canadian release from Alliance Atlantis Communications, but is now unfortunately out-of-print.Due to his growing popularity in Europe and needing a boost in album sales in the U.S., Prince filmed six 1987 concerts in the Netherlands and Belgium for this project. The footage was deemed unusable due a number of technical problems. To move things forward, Prince held a concert at his Paisley Park Studios, with 12 of the 13 tracks (one is a music video) used for the film. The performance sizzles, with Prince delivering a truly memorable show in an intimate setting in Chanhassen, Minnesota.Released nationally in November 1987, the film did not have great box-office success, but gained a new beginning when issued domestically on VHS. It is puzzling why an authorized domestic DVD remains unavailable. Alliance Atlantis has had several ownership changes in the past several years, which could permanently end the production of its excellent DVD.But this DVD is the one to grab...while you still can.

reviewText: I can only vouch for the copy that I have. It did not say remastered. The concert is off the chain, worth a listen. $100.00 is high. The sound quality of mine sucks,but just to be fair, mine did not say remastered. If what they say is true, it is a good buy. I dont think that this concert will be offered on dvd in the U.S. I had the vcr version also, but you know the life of those with a good tape that you watch often. Good luck with your buy. If what they say is true, its worth it.

reviewText: If you were fortunate enough to see its original theatrical release, Prince's "Sign 'O' the Times" (1987) truly rocked the big screen. His Royal Badness and Company kick out the jams for a high-energy performance. The Sheila E. drum solo is one for the ages - along with flat-out brilliant renditions of "Hot Thing" and "Forever in My Life." Prince's finest 85 minutes on celluloid.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the REAL deal. Remastered in Dolby Digital 5.1 picture and sound, this movie will make you subwoofer go BOOOOOOMMMM!!!I have a 60 inch Plasma Widescreen and the Enahanced Pic is AWESOME! I still jam to it and everytime I do, I see something different on the edge or the center of the screen.The only reason I watch this show is for Sheila E's drum solo. I also have a 1000 watt sound system and it pulses from her bass drum and you can hear the cymbals all around the room.I don't know how I watched this on VHS for so long.....Only use the HDMI cord and the Bass will rumble through the room.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hands down, this is simply one of the greatest concert films ever made.  It features Prince when he was at the height of his creativity and the apex of his physical "dancetivity."  This man is a tornado in concert (even still).  If you've never seen Prince live (or even if you have) this movie is really a must.  Skip over Michael Jackson's "This Is It,"  because folks, THIS is it.
summary: Sign O' The Times...for ALL time!
